page.title: 13HOUSING CONTINUED
page.content: Most of the houses are traditional one storey croft houses with 2/3 downstairs rooms and bedrooms/store in the roof. The schoolhouse is similarly constructed but slightly larger. There are 2 modern bungalows built in 1972 and 1977. The 2 large houses on the island are Canna House, built in 1858, which has always been the Laird's house and in which Dr and Mrs Campbell still live and Tigh Ard which was built in 1905 for the then Laird's son. Tigh Ard is used by the National Trust for Scotland for Work parties and other visitors to the island and can accomodate 10 people.
